diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Septic arthritis due to disseminated infection with Neisseria gonorrhoeae
differential_diagnosis: Infectious Arthritis (including viral infections, Lyme disease, and disseminated bacterial infections)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute oligoarthritis and sterile pyuria. Her recent unprotected vaginal intercourse and the findings of high leukocyte counts in the synovial fluid prompted suspicion for sexually transmitted infection. The analysis of synovial fluid confirmed a diagnosis of septic arthritis due to disseminated gonococcal infection.
